title: Advanced Voice Control
description: Context-aware tools, stream-of-consciousness dictation, and workflows within workflows

sections.heading: Context-Aware Voice AI
content: The next level of voice control is context-aware AI. These tools know what application you're using and adapt your words to fit that tool perfectly. You can literally just stream your thoughts, and the AI figures out what you mean.

Imagine this: You're in your email app. You start talking about sending a message to your team. The voice AI knows you're in email, so it automatically formats your words as an email draft - subject line, greeting, body, signature. You didn't have to say 'create email' or give any commands. It just knew.

sections.heading: Stream-of-Consciousness Dictation
content: This is where voice gets really powerful. You don't have to think about structure or format. Just talk. The AI handles the rest.

Example: You're walking to your car and you say: 'Okay so I need to follow up with Sarah about the budget meeting, remind the team about Friday's deadline, and also check in with IT about that server issue we had last week.'

The context-aware voice AI understands you're listing tasks. It creates three separate items, formats them properly, and adds them to your task manager. You didn't say 'create task' three times. You just talked naturally.

sections.heading: Workflows Within Workflows
content: Advanced voice tools let you build custom workflows that trigger automatically based on what you say. This is like having workflows inside your workflows.

For example: You can set up a voice command like 'Start my morning routine' that automatically opens your calendar, reads your top 3 priorities, checks your email for urgent messages, and creates a summary document. All from one spoken phrase.

callout.title: Try This Workflow (10 minutes):
steps: Pick one advanced voice tool for your platform (Mac or Windows)
Install it and go through the quick setup
Open your email app or task manager

Start dictating naturally: 'I need to send three emails today. First one to John about the project update, second to the finance team about budget approval, and third to Sarah thanking her for yesterday's presentation.'
Watch as the tool understands context and creates three separate email drafts or tasks
Refine with voice: 'Make the one to Sarah more casual' or 'Add a deadline to the finance email'
callout.footer: You just created three pieces of work in under 2 minutes using only your voice. That's the power of context-aware AI.

sections.heading: Beyond Getting Started: Combining Voice with AI Workflows
sections.intro: Once you're comfortable with basic voice control, you can chain voice tools with other AI agents to create powerful workflows. Here are three proven workflows you can set up today:

workflows.title: Voice Coding Pipeline (Mac)
workflows.time: 5-7 minutes from idea to working code
workflows.description: Turn spoken code ideas into working implementations without typing

setup.details: In Superwhisper Settings → API Keys, add your Anthropic API key. Create a custom mode called 'Code Spec' that uses Claude 3.5 Sonnet with instructions: 'Convert this spoken code idea into a detailed technical specification with function signatures, type hints, docstrings, and examples.'

Press Option+Spacebar and dictate your code idea naturally: 'I need a Python function that takes a list of dictionaries, filters them by a specific key-value pair, then sorts the results by another key. It should handle missing keys gracefully and return an empty list if no matches found.' Superwhisper sends this to Claude, which creates a detailed specification.

Copy the specification from Superwhisper. Open Cursor and press Cmd+K. Paste the spec and add: 'Implement this function with comprehensive error handling and unit tests.' Cursor generates the complete code.

workflows.result: You spoke your idea while walking to your car. By the time you sit down, you have working, tested code ready to use.

workflows.title: Meeting to Action Items (Cross-Platform)
workflows.description: Automatically transcribe meetings, create Notion documentation, and generate Asana tasks

setup.details: In Otter.ai Settings → Integrations, connect your Zoom, Google Meet, or Microsoft Teams calendar. Otter's AI Meeting Agent will automatically join scheduled meetings.

OPTION A (Otter Enterprise): Use native integrations to send transcripts to Notion and action items to Asana directly. OPTION B (Free/Pro): Create a free Zapier account. Make a Zap: Trigger = 'New Otter Recording', Action 1 = 'Create Notion Page' (map transcript, summary, action items), Action 2 = 'Create Asana Tasks' (from Otter action items list).

During your meeting, Otter transcribes in real-time. After the meeting (2-3 minutes), Otter processes the recording, identifies action items, and automatically creates a Notion page with full transcript and summary, plus Asana tasks for each action item.

workflows.result: Traditional process: 30-45 minutes to transcribe, summarize, and create tasks. With this workflow: 5 minutes to review and assign. You saved 25-40 minutes per meeting.

workflows.title: Long-Form Dictation to Polished Content (Mac/Windows)
workflows.description: Dictate reports, emails, or documents naturally, then have AI polish and format them

setup.details: Download from wisprflow.ai for Mac or Windows. Configure the activation key (default: hold Command on Mac, Ctrl on Windows). In Settings → Personal Dictionary, add any technical terms, names, or jargon specific to your work.

Open any text editor or ChatGPT. Hold your activation key and speak naturally: 'I'm writing a project status report. We completed the data analysis phase ahead of schedule. Three key findings emerged: First, user engagement increased 34% after the interface redesign. Second, mobile usage now represents 67% of total traffic. Third, we identified two critical bugs that need immediate attention.' Release the key when done.

If dictating directly into ChatGPT, add: 'Format this as a professional status report with sections, bullet points, and a clear executive summary.' If dictating elsewhere, copy the text to ChatGPT with the same instruction.

workflows.result: You spoke for 3-4 minutes while doing other things. ChatGPT delivers a polished, formatted report. Total time: 10-15 minutes vs 45-60 minutes typing and formatting manually.

tips.description: Pick the workflow most relevant to your daily work. Master it before adding another. Once it becomes habit, add a second workflow.
The power of voice is that you can work while walking, driving (safely), or doing other tasks. Your commute becomes productive time.
Add technical terms, names, and acronyms to your voice tool's dictionary. This dramatically improves accuracy for your specific domain.
AI-generated content is typically 80-90% perfect. Spend 2-3 minutes reviewing and refining rather than 30-60 minutes creating from scratch.
